fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the moment, there isn't a public endpoint admins can use to retrieve license details or update a license for the applications installed

h3. Suggestion
Create a public endpoint for this purpose

h3. Workaround
* To retrieve the license details by using a private API call: Refer to [How to retrieve application license details via REST API in JIRA 7+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-retrieve-application-license-details-via-rest-api-in-jira-7+-934728265.html]
* To update/set the license by using a private API call: use the same end points as in [How to retrieve application license details via REST API in JIRA 7+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-retrieve-application-license-details-via-rest-api-in-jira-7+-934728265.html], but instead:
** Use the POST method
** Provide the license key in the body by using the format below:
{code}
{"licenseKey": "<LICENSE_KEY>"}
{code}
fields.summary: Retrieve application license details or update license via public REST API

fields.description: Using Agile Methodology within the Operational Support realm should use a Buffer where we would pre-allocate points that would be addressed in tasks that come during the given Sprint.  Is there a go-to way of going about this in JIRA?  I haven't really found a good way to go about this besides tracking Daily Support and Scrum separately, or having a placeholder "Buffer" task with Story Points that deduct as you complete tasks... but this is very manual and time intensive.  Would you happen to have any suggestions?
fields.summary: Options for an Operational Buffer

fields.description:
Hi Team

In the chart type gadgets like Created vs. Resolved Chart, Recently Created Chart, there is no option to select a time frame when we are selecting "*Period*" as "*Daily*" in those gadgets. 

It will be very useful if we can select a particular time frame or more simply a start date for these type of Chart gadgets. It will help us to generate the charts according to our desired time frame. Unlike having a chart with floating dates, it will be more useful to have a chart where we can select the time frame according to our desires.
fields.summary: Provide Specific Time Frame for Chart type gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Trying to license a JIRA Server product requires you to find the server ID so that you can input this value into https://my.atlassian.com in order to generate your license key.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Also have the server ID appear on the JIRA licensing page (Cog Icon -> Applications -> Versions & Licenses in JIRA 7)

h3. Why this is important
It would save customers time and avoid the frustration of locating that specific value deeply buried on the system info page

Please see Confluence screenshot as they include this on their corresponding page
 !conflicenseexample.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Place Server ID on the license details page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the issue type in the create issue dialog box, the dialog box will refresh itself and all text inputted in a Wiki renderer custom field will be gone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Multi-line Text field custom field.
# Set the renderer of the custom field to be "Wiki Renderer"
# Associate this custom field to the create issue screen.
# Attempt to create a new issue to prompt the Create Issue dialog to appear.
# Input some text into the text field of the custom field in Visual Mode.
# Change the issue type of the issue in the create issue dialog.

h3. Expected Results
* The issue type is changed without any consequences

h3. Actual Results
* All the Multi-line custom fields in the creation screen have their dialog box refreshed and the text is gone.
 
h3.Workaround
* Ensure that you change the issue type and/or project first before inputting any text.

h3. Notes
* The issue also occurs if changing the project will trigger a change in the selected Issue Type.
* The issue only occurs when there is more than one line of text in the field.
fields.summary: Changing issue types in issue creation screen will clear content of wiki render custom field.

fields.description:
h5. Feature Summary

Currently in Confluence, there is an open notification option available at the main menu which users can click on to see all the latest notifications for them as well as see what is going on.

 !image-2017-08-10-21-04-28-318.png|thumbnail! 

JIRA on the other does not have such a functionality and the users would need to view the Activity stream on a dashboard to have a clear grasp of what is going on and who is doing what.

h5. Feature Request

Can a functionality similar to the Confluences Notification menu bar be added to JIRA?
fields.summary: Add Open Notification to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to automatically close the ticket and move the ticket to multiple projects in JIRA. The current clone option just clones ticket in the same project and we need to manually move it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature in JIRA whereby when can set in a project setting such way that every ticket raised in Project A can be replicated automatically in Project B and C or more.

h3. Why this is important
When you are dealing with multiple customers and providing a similar solution using software than one issue or bug reported by a customer would be applicable for others as well. In this case having automatic clone option would help to reduce the effort and people can put their effort for the other activity. 

h3. Workaround 
There is two plugin available which provides option to clone and move but still, the operation needs manual intervention. Below are the plugins:
# [Clone And Move for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.ideotechnologies.jira.plugins.clone-and-move-jira-plugin/server/overview] 
# [Clone Plus for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.jira.clone-plus/server/overview]
fields.summary: Option to Automatically clone and Move Ticket to Multiple Project

fields.description:
h5. Feature Summary

When a user access the customer portal, they should see a set of request types they can select from.

If the user decides to search for a request type, JIRA Service Desk does not show any hint that the result below is the result for issue types that match the string the customer typed in or even how it performs the search.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Feature Request

Can the UI be updated to show customers that the result shown under the search bar are a result of issue types which contain the string searched in either the request type name or the request type description field?
fields.summary: Improvement to Issue Type Search in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 User would like to have a feature to integrate JIRA server with Trello

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a way to integrate JIRA server with Trello. -As of now, it is only available for JIRA cloud via JIRA Cloud Power-Up for Trello plugin which developed by Atlassian itself.-

There is now a server version available here: [Trello Connector for JIra Server|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.trello.jello/server/overview], find our more on the Trello website: http://help.trello.com/article/1081-using-the-jira-power-up

It would be so good having this feature in the on-premise instance.

Thank's a lot.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA has a *Date Picker* custom field, which accepts values which are formatted as described in *Administration >> System >> General Configuration >> Advanced Settings* as the *jira.date.picker.java.format*. By default, the format that is defined in JIRA is as follows:
 * jira.date.picker.java.format : d/MMM/yy
 * jira.date.picker.javascript.format : %e/%b/%y

When a user attempts to create an issue which has a *Date Picker* custom field and enters a date in a format that is unrecognized, JIRA will throw an error and prevent the issue from being created:
{quote}Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy".
{quote}
*However*, it is possible to reconfigure the date picker format to an alternate, desired format. Though the specifics are unknown, certain formats will cause JIRA to throw a different error, while still creating the issue. In these circumstances, users who incorrectly enter the format may unwittingly create multiple issues, while believing that the issues are not being created.

Such issues created in this fashion have the following problems:
 * They are not indexed, and do not come up in issue navigator searches until later reindexes
 * The will not have the *Date Picker* custom field properly set

Users will not realize that these issues were created until a reindex later on, where all of the erroneously created issues will spontaneously appear.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.4.0
 * MS SQL Server 2012

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start with a fresh or existing JIRA instance
 # Create a brand new project (Project Type does not matter)
 # Create a new custom field of type *Date Picker* (e.g. "Date of Birth") and associate it with all screens in this project
 # Navigate to *Administration >> System >> General Configuration >> Advanced Settings*
 # Adjust jira.date.picker.java.format to {{MM/dd/yyyy}}
 # Adjust jira.date.picker.javascript.format to {{%m/%d/%Y}}
 # Create an issue, setting the *Date Picker* field to a value which does not align with the provided format (i.e. 01/01/14)

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should reject the issue creation with a warning that the supplied date format of 01/01/14 does not meet the expected format MM/dd/yyyy.
h3. Actual Results

1. JIRA rejects the issue creation with a different warning:
{quote}We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{quote}
2. The following error is thrown in the application logs:
{code:java}
2017-08-09 15:35:09,286 http-nio-8098-exec-19 ERROR kliou 935x880x1 1rhnhcp 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Error creating issue: 
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][parentkey,null][customfield,10203][issue,10013][datevalue,0014-01-01 00:00:00.0][id,10037] (SQL Exception while setting value:  (Only dates between January 1, 1753 and December 31, 9999 are accepted.)){code}
3. The issue is *still* created, though the issue is not indexed and cannot be searched for. You may still access the issue directly via it's URL, which can be determined by the last known Issue Key and incrementing it's value by 1 (i.e. if the last issue key in this project was PROJ-12345, PROJ-12346 would have been created by this attempt). Alternatively, the database may be queried in the *jiraissue* table for the issuekey with the ID specified in the SQLException above (10013).
h3. Workaround
 * Avoid modifying the format of the date picker in JIRA's Advanced Settings, and use the default format instead, which seems to have a better functioning handler for invalid values
 * Use the widget to select your date picker value, rather than typing it in. This will avoid improper formatting
 * For the above example specifically, adjust the format from {{MM/dd/yyyy}} to {{MM/dd/yy}}. This will accept values where only the last two digits of the year value is offered, but may lead to inconsistent results (testing results show that a year value of "37" will assume 1937, but a year value of "36" will assume 2036).
fields.summary: Creating issue with invalid date format will still create issue even though error is thrown

h5. Feature Summary

As an extension to this [feature request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60483] it would be great to allow JIRA System admins to set the copy attachments and copy links to enabled by default if these 2 options are required when creating linked issues in their organization.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With JIRA Vanilla versions 7.3 and 7.4 bundled plugin JIRA iCalendar plugin is installed. But if you click on it you will see message: "This add-on is not compatible with your JIRA instance. Request an update from the vendor."

On the marketplace i can see that plugin is incompatible with current versions 7.3 and 7.4
 [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.extra.jira-ical-feed/versions]
{noformat}
1.4.7 - JIRA Server 7.0.0 - 7.2.10 -  2015-10-20  Bug fix release for JIRA 7
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 7.3 or 7.4
 # Locate system add-on IRA iCalendar plugin
 # Expand the view for that plugin

h3. Expected Results
 # No error/information message is displayed

h3. Actual Results
 # Error/information message will be displayed "This add-on is not compatible with your JIRA instance. Request an update from the vendor." !original.png!

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira iCalendar bundled/system plugin is displaying that is not compatible with Jira 7.3.x and 7.4.x

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* In the documentation for JIRA 7.3 and 7.4 it is mentioned that the project import can create projects if they do not exist.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Access either [Restoring project for JIRA 7.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/restoring-a-project-from-backup-861253833.html#Restoringaprojectfrombackup-restoreprojectRestoringyourproject] or [Restoring project for JIRA 7.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/restoring-a-project-from-backup-881684008.html#Restoringaprojectfrombackup-restoreprojectRestoringyourproject]
* We find the following mention:  [^screenshot-2.png]

h5. Expected Behavior
* When trying to import a project with the project Import, JIRA creates a project when it does not exist.

h5. Actual Behavior
* Project import will show a message saying: "JIRA did not find a project with key 'XXX'(project key) to import your issues into. Please create a project with key 'XXX' that contains compatible workflow and issue types". See example  [^screenshot-1.png]

h5.Workaround
There is no workaround for this issue.

h5. Notes:
* The test was performed making a backup, then deleting a project from that instance, and trying to restore the deleted project which makes it identical. After creating a project with the same Key, it was possible to import the project without any issues.
* Since there is a specific message for this, it is very likely that the functionality changed at some point and now it simply does not create the project.
fields.summary: Project import does not create projects

fields.description: Dashboards change, evolve.  It's a serious pain in the gadgets when we need to edit a filter that is no longer working or needs to be modified.  Most gadgets just throw their arms up and quit.  When you try to find which filter is problematic sometimes you get a name, sometimes just an ID.  Then you need to take another step to go to Manage Filters, and since that junk drawer of a screen has no categorization or organization of any sort you need to scroll until you find your filter, and THEN you can edit it.  There should be an "Edit Filter" option RIGHT THERE on the gadget.
fields.summary: Provide dashboard owners with an "Edit Filter" option on all filter based gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to dismiss JIRA Capture version warning when migrating from Cloud to Server

h3. Environment
* JIRA Version:
** 7.3.X +
* Capture Version: 
** 2.9.13.0
** 2.9.15

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restore a cloud instance backup which had JIRA Capture installed to JIRA Server  
# Install JIRA Capture on Server

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to dismiss version warning when migrating from Cloud to Server

h3. Actual Results
No option to dismiss the warning:
 !banner.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Add the following code on JIRA's Announcement Banner:
{code:html}
<style>
.bonfire-headsup{
display: none;
}
</style>
{code}
(!) Do note that this may remove all warning messages from JIRA Capture
fields.summary: Unable to dismiss JIRA Capture version warning when migrating from Cloud to Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA CSV Importer showing incorrect value when there are warning and error during validation.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a *Checkboxes* customfield named *Atlassian*. Under the customfield, create options *Atlassian 1*, *Atlassian 2*.
# Create a CSV file with following entries:
{code}
Summary;Sescription;Assignee;Atlassian
test;test;charlie;Atlassian 1
test;test;charlie;Atlassian 2
test;test;charlie;JIRA 1
test;test;charlie2;
{code}
# Ensure that the user charlie & charlie2 do not have assign permission.
# Import the CSV using the *Import Issues from CSV* option.
# Import the CSV file created earlier and map the fields provided above.
# Import wil will show that negative issues created:

 !CSV.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment


h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows *0* issue/s will be created correctly


h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows *-X* issue/s will be created correctly

X can be any number of issues failed to be imported.


h3.Workaround

Fix the error in validation process and re-import the CSV file again.
fields.summary: JIRA CSV importer showing negative issues created

fields.description:
Hi Team, 

Need your help to understand what is the best Archival strategy for JIRA projects, those are not in use and sitting ideal from a long time.

As of now we have an Archive JIRA server, where we move the project from our JIRA Prod server, it's not the easy/efficient way to handle this situation, and required lot's of manual effort too.

I think there are few other ways using that we can make everyone's life easy.

On the basis of my past experience, if you guys can do some little change in the JIRA DB schema, specially in the Project table if you can add one more column to retain flag, if the project is active or not, and on the basis of that flag Lucene search will pull out  only active project issues from Database and leave the rest of the issues. This will allow JIRA to build the indexes for the stuff which is active and left the inactive project. 

This little change in schema and relevant web pages can makes everyone life easy, and we don't really need to worry about the Archival process any more.

Please feel free to ping me, if you need any other information from my side.

Regards,

Amit
fields.summary: JIRA Archival Strategy

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when importing data from FogBugz to JIRA, bullets and numbered lists in comments will be lost on JIRA, as it does not recognize the format from FogBugz

h3. Suggested Solution

Modify JIRA Importers Plugin to handle formatting when importing from FogBugz to keep comments as they were.

h3. Why this is important

Many customers use intensively this resource in FogBugz, and since this is not kept on JIRA, it requires manual editing for each imported issue to bring back the format.
fields.summary: FogBugz importer to JIRA won't keep numbered lists and bullets

On the Link to JIRA Issue page (http://<urll>/secure/LinkJiraIssue!default.jspa?) the hyperlink "search for an issue" doesn't work.

fields.description: I get it, a date is a date and when you use the date picker custom field, in the issue view it smartly organizes the date fields (even custom fields) into the date panel.  The problem is, I don't want those fields in the dates panel where they'll get lost among created and updated dates.  I'd like to have them in the details panel.  Is there an easy way to change/choose which panel custom fields are displayed in?  I could understand date fields being in the date panel by default, but some flexibility would be nice in choosing which panel to display custom fields in.
fields.summary: Ability to put custom fields in different panels

fields.description: Summary says it all – in addition to the "Issue Count" and "Issue Count, excluding sub-tasks" we would like to see "subtasks" as an option as well.

There is currently no option to let you pick and choose what commits you would like to work with – this would help us out a lot as our organization uses this functionality quite a bit.
fields.summary: Give the Ability to Select Specific Commits when Creating a Crucible Review from JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We can import attachments with following the instruction described in [How to import attachment using CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira061/jira-administrators-faq/usage-faq/how-to-import-attachment-using-csv]. (I confirmed that the solution still works on JIRA 7.4.1.)

Currently, JIRA doesn't allow us to use special characters like {{"#"}}, {{","}}, {{"["}} used in attachment field. (e.g. {{file://csvimport/test#test.txt}}) We can attach files which are using such special characters in the file names from the UI.
The way to escape special characters is described in [Treating special characters literally|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/importing-data-from-csv-881683854.html#ImportingdatafromCSV-EncapsulatingJIRAdatastructureinyourCSVfile] but it doesn't work in this case.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be better if we could use such special characters in attachment field even when importing attachment using CSV.

h3. Workaround

Replace the special characters manually as per its URL encoding, refer to https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.asp
fields.summary: Add support for special characters used in attachment field when importing attachment using CSV

fields.description: In Chrome 60, While copying and pasting HTML content paste with HTML instead of HTML content.
fields.summary: Chrome 60 - copy paste to comments adding html

fields.description:
h3. Definition

For workflows, screens and field configuration, the DELETE option is not available when it's associated to a scheme but that is not the case for  Issue type schemes. Whether it's associated to a project or not, the DELETE option is there.
h3. Suggestion

DELETE option should not be available if the issue type scheme is associated to a project. In this way, all the project configuration will be uniformed.
fields.summary: Delete Option should not be Available if the Issue type scheme is associated to a project

fields.description: The documentation around configuring tomcat inside JIRA when JIRA is running behind a web server or proxy that handles https:// for JIRA is not as complete as it should be and some customers are ending up with a non-optimal configuration. This seems to be due to information about setting the appropriate attributes of the tomcat Connector element found <JIRA_INSTALL>/conf/server.xml (secure should be set to true and updating the scheme, proxyName & proxyPort as well as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/integrating-jira-with-apache-using-ssl-203395380.html needs to be done appropriately) not being present on the information for using a proxy (or Apache) in front of JIRA on pages such as https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/proxying-atlassian-server-applications-with-apache-http-server-mod_proxy_http-806032611.html .
fields.summary: Update the proxy documentation around setting the appropriate attributes when JIRA is behind a web server or proxy and is available by https://

fields.description:
h3. +Scenario+

When a (new) custom field context is created for a custom field of type Select List (single choice), JIRA creates the following entries in the database:
 * 1 entry in table fieldconfiguration to store the context itself
 * 1 entry in table fieldconfigscheme to store the context scheme
 * X entries in table fieldconfigschemeissuetype to link the above 2 together, plus the issue type context (restricted to which issue type/s)
 * X entries in table configurationcontext to store the project context (restricted to which project/s)
 * X entries in table customfieldoption to store the number of options
 * 1 entry in table genericconfiguration to store the default value (if any)

For example, this custom field context (created when custom field is created):

!field.png|thumbnail!

has these entries in the database:

!db.png|thumbnail!

The relationships between the tables and columns are as follows:
 * fieldconfigscheme.id = fieldconfigschemeissuetype.fieldconfigscheme = configurationcontext.fieldconfigscheme (/)
 * fieldconfiguration.id = fieldconfigschemeissuetype.fieldconfiguration = genericconfiguration.datakey (/)
 * {{fieldconfiguration.id = customfieldoption.customfieldconfig (i)}}

h3. +Problem+

According to the above, there's no relationship between {{fieldconfigscheme.id}} and {{fieldconfiguration.id}}, and they do mismatch. Currently, when JIRA needs to look up {{customfieldoption.customfieldconfig}} for available options, it fails because it incorrectly uses {{fieldconfigscheme.id}} instead of {{fieldconfiguration.id}}, leading to *options not found*.

(!) So far this is known to cause only Project Import problem, as in JRASERVER-63226.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Create a custom field as in the above example
 # Modify the database to make {{fieldconfigscheme.id}} differ from {{fieldconfiguration.id}}:
{code:java}
1. update fieldconfigscheme set id = 99999 where id = 10500;
2. update fieldconfigschemeissuetype set fieldconfigscheme = 99999 where fieldconfigscheme = 10500;
3. update configurationcontext set fieldconfigscheme = 99999 where fieldconfigscheme = 10500;{code}
(!) This is for testing purpose only, but it happens in real situations.
 # Restart JIRA for the change to take effect
 # Create an issue that the field is available for, and give the field a value in that issue e.g. Peugeot
 # Create an XML backup
 # Delete the issue in step 4 to make the project ready for project import
 # Use the backup in step 5 to perform a project import

h3. +Expected behavior+

There's no validation error regarding the custom field options, because the custom field exists with exactly the same context and options.
h3. +Actual behavior+

JIRA says it can't find the option Peugeot needed to import the issue:

!import.png|thumbnail!

(x) JIRA uses 99999 to look up the options, but the options use 10500.
h3. +Workaround+

It's possible to modify the entities.xml and update {{customfieldoption.customfieldconfig}} with {{fieldconfigscheme.id}}. In this example, find the following lines:
{code:java}
<CustomFieldOption id="10300" customfield="10200" customfieldconfig="10500" sequence="0" value="Peugeot" disabled="N"/>
<CustomFieldOption id="10301" customfield="10200" customfieldconfig="10500" sequence="1" value="Honda" disabled="N"/>{code}
and replace them with:
{code:java}
<CustomFieldOption id="10300" customfield="10200" customfieldconfig="99999" sequence="0" value="Peugeot" disabled="N"/>
<CustomFieldOption id="10301" customfield="10200" customfieldconfig="99999" sequence="1" value="Honda" disabled="N"/>{code}
Then save the file, zip it back, and use the zip to perform project import.

(!) The modified zip file should only be used for project import. Once done, it should be destroyed as the custom field configuration association is already messed.

(+) For more details, please refer to [Project Import fails due to missing Custom Field Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+fails+due+to+missing+Custom+Field+Options].
fields.summary: JIRA incorrectly uses fieldconfigscheme ID instead of fieldconfiguration ID to look up Custom Field Options

fields.description:
The REST API for JIRA Server currently allows to set most of the user profile settings, as defined in [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-updateUser]

Unfortunately, the "locale" is missing. 

JIRA Cloud seems to allow setting the locale using the REST API:

[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-updateUser]

This is required to allow a workaround for the issue described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-819?focusedCommentId=1578012&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-1578012

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Steps:
1. Add the 'test user' to Project Role-Administrators
2. Login into the JIRA instance as 'test user'
3. Click on the delete icon in the Users and Role section of the respective project beside the 'test user' account.

When the test users clicks the delete icon for the first time, the expected behaviour is to not be able to access the same page again because that user is no longer part of the Project Admins. It's just that the UI doesn't immediately show it unless you refresh the page then you will see the below screenshot. 
[^project.png]

The second time you click the delete icon, the warning message shows up. 
[^role.png]

It's because by right, that user should have been removed from the Project admins the first time the user clicked on the delete icon. Refreshing the page will lead to [^project.png] as expected. 


h3. Suggestion

It would be great if there's a warning message that will pop up when attempting to delete your user account from the Project Administrator role such as "You are trying to remove yourself from the role and you will lose access to this project". If the user clicks "Proceed" on the warning dialog, the page should refresh automatically displaying [^project.png]
fields.summary: Warning Message when Deleting your own User Account from the Project Administrators role

fields.description:
Today I was using the permission helper to figure out why a user could not edit a comment.

I filled in the form with username, issue and "Edit Own Comments" permission and the helper reported "User has the 'Edit Own Comments' permission. So why could the user not edit his comment?

After some googling, I figured out the reason; the issue was in a workflow step with the jira.issue.editable property set to false.

I suggest that the permission helper shows a warning if the selected issue is in a state with jira.issue.editable=false.
fields.summary: Permission helper warning if jira.issue.editable=false

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using Internet Explorer 11, navigate to any issue on your JIRA instance.
 # Type some text in the comment section at the bottom.
 # Click on the "Cancel" button.
 # A warning dialog "You have entered a comment on this issue. If you navigate away from this page without first saving, the comment will be lost." will pop out
 # Click on "Ok" to acknowledge the error (and dismiss popup).
 # Click on the comment button again and try inputting a comment in the comment section.

h3. Expected Results

The text editor for the comment section will be working fine and the comment can still be edited.
h3. Actual Results

It is no longer possible to input any text into the comment section, the text cursor can still be moved around but no text will appear when attempting to type.
fields.summary: Not able to input text in the comment section in IE11 after cancelling the comment warning.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The user is currently able to transition an issue without validating the user's intention to do so.

h3. Suggested Solution
Request user for confirmation (Eg. in form of a message box) to transition an issue.
 
h3. Workaround
Add a required custom field (Eg. A check box) on the screen that is associated with a transition which asks the user to validate the transition.
fields.summary: Request user for confirmation before transitioning an issue

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Dev Wizards

Please can we have some new elements to make pages more useful within Jira and Jira service desk?

You've touched on field-itis here: https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/8-steps-to-jira-field-greatness

Well, we're at risk of catching it. I don't want loads of different pages, for subtyle changes in purpose, or additional scereen schemes as it just creates admin-burden having to manage a whole set of other pages.

So, when adding fields onto a page under Admin "Configure Screen" can we have the ability to add something other than fields to a page?

Like:

* H1, H2, and H3 titles
* Tickboxes alongside fields to make them Read Only on this page only! i.e still editable on every other page, but so they can be provided for viewing on this page, allowing an agent to make decisions based on data displayed by the pages.
* Page Text (as guidance / field information text - support to help people find their way around screens (show in red on the image)

All elements would be drag and droppable around the screen to allow their order to be changed and would basically work like existing field element containers.

This really would open up a lot more potential for User Driven automations / workflows within Jira. Silent Automation is great, but sometimes, involving users in the process and allowing them to make decisions based on data presented to them is really useful.

 !2500.jpeg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Non Field Page elements in Jira - Enhancements for Automation

fields.description: My workstation sends output to two monitors.  I would like the ability when working with Kanban boards to drag the issue details section onto the second monitor and leave the view with columns and swim lanes on the first monitor.   This would allow for all issue details to be more easily seen.  I perceive treating the issue detail view like a ribbon in an office application where it can be detached from the main view and positioned wherever I want whether it be on the primary or secondary monitor.
fields.summary: Multi-Screen Support for Kanban Boards
Inconsistent information provided in JIRA upgrade documentation

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * When trying to delete a user, if the username contains special characters like "@","#","%" and others, the JQL generated to locate user's existent issues does not work.

Error thread:
{quote}The character '@' is a reserved JQL character. You must enclose it in a string or use the escape '\u0040\ instead.{quote}

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to JIRA Administration > User management.
 * From the right "..." select "Delete User"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * JIRA will indicate that the user is included in existent issues, and provide a link to search for them:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! )
 * Click on the link

h5. Expected Behavior
 * JIRA shows a list of the issues where the selected user is involved

h5. Actual Behavior
 * JIRA displays a JQL error: !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

h5. Cause
 * JIRA not considering that special characters break JQL queries when generating the search query.

h5. Workaround
 * After the JQL gives the error, encase the username in quote marks ("...") and the search will work:
 * !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When trying to delete a user, if the username contains special characters like "@","#","%" and others, the JQL generated to locate user's existent issues does not work.

The Mail Queue page is not available in Cloud but this is not included in the list of differences at 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA does not provide a built in feature to generate and export usage and growth reports. Administrators have to resort to workarounds, such as verifying JIRA System Info manually or querying the database directly to get such information, and then generate the reports using a separate tool.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a feature that allows administrators to get such information in an easy way, generate the reports/charts and export them to common formats.
h3. Why this is important

Having a better way to verify usage and growth and reporting it has several uses, such as:
 * Manage licensing
 * Track users and customers adoption
 * Justify new investments in the application
 * Anticipate infrastructure upgrades
 * Etc
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin i want to be able to generate usage and growth report charts and be able to export them in a readable format.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current JIRA administrator doesn't have track of nodes joining/leaving the cluster. 
It makes it hard to investigate network partitioning problem or other related cluster activities. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add following features 
* Add logging at each node in the cluster, while joining the cluster
** At already active nodes: log details about the node joined the cluster 
** At new node:  log details about the nodes already in the cluster 
* Add logging at each node in the cluster, while other node is removed from the cluster
** with decision details why node is removed 
* Add table which will keep historical track of the nodes status. 
 
h3. Workaround 
* None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want have history of nodes joining the cluster

fields.description:
When performing several changes in an issue through a screen (like the Edit screen), this might trigger several notifications at the same time for the same user, this notifications reach the Mail Queue and , at the time of flushing the mail queue, JIRA follows some unclear rules to create one consolidated notification containing all of them (it seems to appear as a new notification with an 'envelope' icon [^screenshot-1.png] , but this is purely a conjecture and it might be just JIRA indicating that it is flushing the notifications one by one) using one of the notifications to be the 'title' (like 'Assigned' or 'Updated') but will also include all the other changes made in it. 

When multiple notifications for the same user are in the Mail Queue, by testing it seems the current behavior to choose the 'title' is:
# If an "Issue Assigned" is among the notifications, it is chosen to be the title.
# If there is no "Issue Assigned" notification, an "Issue updated" notification will be sent with all the changes.
# For some reason, if one of the changes made is Work logged added, it triggers a completely separate notification in adition to the "assigned" or "updated" notification, and might even contain changes that are alread included in them ( see example, the due date and assignee change ware included in both notifications [^screenshot-2.png])
# Comments added through a screen do not trigger the "Commented notification" nor are included in the list of changes made.

The suggestion is to make a dedicated documentation page for the JIRA Mail Queue (as there is none to be found at the moment), including the rules and priorities for the notifications.

Notes: 
* All the tests were done using the 'Reporter' as test subject. All changes to the issue were done by an admin user.
* The test was done in clean JIRA Software Server 7.3.8 and 7.4.0.
* Changing the order of the fields in the screen does not seem to affect the behavior.
fields.summary: Document how Mail Queue works, including how JIRA prioritizes notifications when more than one is triggered for the same user ( like in Edit issue)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is have stated that:
{quote}
PostgreSQL 7.2 and later require a schema to be specified in the {{<schema-name/>}} element. If your PostgreSQL database uses the default '{{public}}' schema, this should be specified in the {{<schema-name/>}} element as shown below. Ensure that your database schema name is lower-case, as JIRA cannot work with PostgreSQL databases whose schema names contain upper-case characters.
{quote}
From the [official PSQL documentation|https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.0/static/ddl-schemas.html], when using a schema other than {{public}}, DBA needs to update the {{search_path}} to include the new schema.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to include this information.

h3. Note
A bug that is affected by this is [JRASERVER-64886|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64886].
fields.summary: Update Connecting Postgres documentation with search_path

*Definition*
Today jira.i18n.title and jira.i18n.submit only accept i18n property keys that you need to set system wide or via addons. Allowed values as of today 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/workflow-properties-802592825.html

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to auto-transition/change state an issue when it has been assigned to a user.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow triggers in a chosen workflow transition to include detection of changes made to the issue such as an issue being assigned.
h3. Workaround

A third-party plugin ([Automation for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.codebarrel.addons.automation/server/overview]) is able to provide a solution to the above Problem Definition. It is achieved by creating a custom rule that changes the status/transition an issue when a change to the issue (Issue is assigned) is detected.
 Note: The following workaround is for the plugin installed in JIRA 6.4.2

# Install '*Automation for JIRA*' as an add-on through *Atlassian Marketplace* in JIRA (found under *Administration > Add-ons*). 
# Once you have installed the plugin, under '*Administration > Add-ons*' click on 'Automation' located in the left-hand panel.
# Then, right-click on the *'Add Rule' button* on the top-right of the page.
# You will need to enter a name for this rule (Eg. 'Assign to me rule'). *Click* on *'Enable rule once created?'* checkbox and click 'Next' to continue.
# Under 'Select Trigger' section, choose '*Issue Event Trigger*' for the 'Select Trigger' *option*.
# Under 'Issue Event' option, select '*Issue Assigned*' in the drop-down list. You may also *choose to restrict users* that can change the status when they assign the issue by clicking on the 'Restrict which users can trigger this event?' checkbox. Click 'Next' to continue.
# Under the 'Add Actions' section, select '*Transition Issue Action*'. A new option called 'Workflow Transition' will appear which allows you to *choose what Status* to transition the issue. Select the *appropriate transition* from the drop-down box. You may also *choose to enable additional actions to trigger* when an issue is assigned by clicking on the *'Add action' button.* Click 'Next' to continue.
# *Confirm the details* of the rule before saving it. The rule that you've created would be *enabled immediately*.
fields.summary: Ability to auto transition an issue/change state when the issue is assigned

fields.description:
If I select text I have typed in a text box such as this Description box, and then click the link button or press ctrl-K, I get a popup to specify link type. I then select External link. Jira then wraps the selected text as follows and then selects the selected text as though I were going to change it. I just typed it, so why would I change it, right?
[selected text.|http://example.com]

This makes no sense. My next step is to specify the link location, so that's what should have been selected. i.e. "http://example.com" should have been selected . That way, I can click the Delete key to remove it and then paste in the link location.
fields.summary: When creating an External Link using Wiki Markup (Ctrl + k) select URL by default not the Alias

JIRA is currently not offered with any standard OS packaging, and makes life difficult for admins.

The attached SRPM provides both an RPM spec file and init script for JIRA.

The atlassian-jira-core-7.4.1.tar.gz download is compressed twice for some reason - gunzip the file until the raw tar file remains, and place the raw tar file atlassian-jira-core-7.4.1.tar into the SOURCES directory. Build the final RPM by running "rpmbuild -bb atlassian-jira-core.spec".

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

/status request to JIRA Data Center returns "MAINTENANCE" instead of "RUNNING" when the node is actually Running and not in Maintenance mode.

!/images/icons/emoticons/information.png|width=16,height=16!  This affects JIRA Server as well.
h3. Note

Note that this bug is known to usually occur when the Database is configured with an unsupported collation
h3. +Environment+
 * JIRA 7.4.x (Server, Data Center)

h3. +Steps to Reproduce+
 # Startup a JDC node running JIRA 7.4.x
 # Log in the node and ensure the node is running well (to avoid {-}JRASERVER-59503{-})
 # Access the URL <node-address>/status

h3. +Expected Results+

This will return the following JSON object {{

{"state":"RUNNING"}

}}.
h3. +Actual Results+

This returns {{

{"state":"MAINTENANCE"}

}} and stays that way forever.

(!) Manually performing a re-index doesn't help. Once the re-index completes, the state is still Maintenance.
h3. Workaround and notes

Please check Jira does not contain any startup warnings. This can be done by accessing
<Jira BASE URL>/secure/errors.jsp

Quite common case the issue occurs when Jira's database is using an unsupported collation. See an example below.

!Screen Shot 2017-12-19 at 10.21.52.png|thumbnail!

If that is the case, you can follow the instructions to fix that on your instance [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/health-check-database-collation-790955315.html]

If you decide to utilize MySQL's utf8mb4_bin collation in Jira versions 7.6 or 7.13 the following automation script can be used to acknowledge the database collation warning:
{code:java}
function clear_maintenance_mode_for_db_collation {
    maint_check=$( curl -s localhost:7101/status | grep -c "MAINTENANCE" | cat )
    if [  "${maint_check}" -gt 0 ]; then
        collation_check=$( curl -s http://localhost:7101/secure/errors.jsp | grep -c "unsupported collation: utf8mb4_bin" | cat )
        if [  "${collation_check}" -gt 0 ]; then
            curl -u "${JIRA_CREDS}" http://localhost:7101/secure/johnson/events/dismiss
            curl -u "${JIRA_CREDS}" http://localhost:7101/secure/johnson/warnings/acknowledge
            sleep 5s
        fi
    fi    
}
{code}
Please note we strongly advise an upgrade to Jira 8 or above which supports this natively
fields.summary: /status returns Maintenance instead of Running when nodes are not in Maintenance mode

fields.description:

When the user adds a screenshot to a comment via the system keyboard shortcut or right-click menu the full sized image is added to the comment. If the image is too big it will fill the whole comment section

fields.description: When creating or editing an issue, if you want to link another issue the dropdown only displays a set lefthanded part of the full issue title, if the summary is long enough, it will not be completely visible. The suggestion is to add a bubble text/tooltip with the full text when the mouse pointer hovers the item from the list or allow expansion of the complete window so that it all fits.
fields.summary: Add tooltip to the dropdown list when linking Issues

fields.description:
Clicking on the Log Work shortcut, I see this popup:

!image-2017-07-28-14-40-45-558.png!

To log work on an issue, I enter a number of hours and the date that the work was performed on. This works, but is hardly ideal.

 

99% (actually might even be 100%) of the time, when I come to this screen I want to log the hours I've performed on a task each day of the work week. It would be much, much better if the "Date Started" textbox was replaced by a "Day of Week" widget. It would easily allow me to select M/T/W/T/F without having to click through to an unwieldy monthly calendar.

 

A second, related improvement would be for the Activity Log of the issue to display a more useful work-week based view. This would also help when completing timesheets.
fields.summary: Log Work popup should be day of week driven

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copy and pasting filter name with Korean characters resulting in the the filter name to be shown in Unicode. For a better understanding, please watch the video recording; {{https://www.screencast.com/t/VqOw7BsTWwSn}}. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter with Korean character, for example {{안녕하세요}}.
# Add *Created vs. Resolved* gadget to a dashboard.
# Configure the gadget filter to {{안녕하세요}} at first.
# Then edit the gadget and paste {{안녕하세요}} as the filter name without choosing the autosuggestion.
# Edit the gadget again and then you can see that {{안녕하세요}} is being shown as {{안녕하세요}}.

h3. Expected Results
{{안녕하세요}} shows as {{안녕하세요}}.

h3. Actual Results
{{안녕하세요}} shows as {{안녕하세요}}.
 
h3. Notes
# Tested this on Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox.
# Tested on Pie Chart gadget and this is not happening in this gadget (included in the video recording as well).
# If an Admin user ends up editing some gadget, since the filter name will be in Unicode, it's not in a readable format. Please use {{https://mothereff.in/html-entities}} to decode the string back to Korean language.
#* Paste the string, for example {{안녕하세요}} to the *Encoded* section and you will get the Korean characters on the *Decoded* section.
fields.summary: Unicode Korean filter name in Created vs. Resolved gadget

This is because the acronyms are sometimes in the end of a long name. This makes search a bit tedious when you need to guess and correct.

Mouse over the value to see the full name in the tooltip
fields.summary: Issue search view: Dropdown menus too narrow, hindering seeing complete values

fields.description:
h3. Definition
For workflows, screens and field configuration, the DELETE option is not available when it's associated to a scheme but that is not the case for issue types. Whether it's associated or not, the DELETE option is there.

h3. Suggestion
DELETE option should not be available if the issue type is associated to a scheme. In this way, all the project configuration will be uniformed.
fields.summary: Delete Option should not be Available if the Issue type is associated to a Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Creating a new project creates a configuration like workflow, screen, issue types scheme etc specific for that project. However, deleting a project does not automatically deletes these configurations which is no longer useful as the project has been removed. Hence, you need to manually delete those configurations.

h3. Suggestion
To have the option to delete these configurations when deleting a project if that project config is not shared to any other projects.
fields.summary: Deleting a Project Should Delete Corresponding Unshared Configurations

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to the KB articles below, JIRA should reset the issue type to the default one when creating ticket in a new user session. However in the latest version of JIRA, JIRA will still remember the last issue type when creating ticket in the same project after user has opened a new session.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-default-issue-type-displayed-at-the-create-issue-screen-707986896.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/default-issue-type-when-create-an-issue-301662415.html

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a default issue type in project settings.
# Create a ticket with an issue type that is different from the default one.
# Logout JIRA and login again or open JIRA in another browser.
# Click *Create* button to create a ticket in the same project.

h3. Expected Results
In the issue creation form the issue type should be reset to the default one.

h3. Actual Results
In the issue creation form the issue type remains the one that has been selected in step 2.
 
h3. Notes
This issue cannot be reproduced on a JIRA 6.3 instance.
When changing the project to another one, JIRA will still remember the issue type if the target project also contains the selected issue type.
fields.summary: Issue type is not reset to the default one when creating ticket in a new session

fields.description: Is there any way to hide the week number ("wk") in the calendar date selector?  Most users are used to Sunday being the first column of numbers in a calendar and are frequently selecting the wrong date because of this.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to hide the week number in the calendar selector
JIRA should better handle scenarios where there is a duplicate username on an external directory

fields.description:
Now that JIRA has several different project types (Software, Service Desk, Business), it would make sense to allow for configuration of different Roles per project type.

For example, Service Desk Agent roles would not be relevant to Software projects.
fields.summary: Roles per Project Type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the export function in Internet Explorer breaks some of the dropdown menus in the top bar (Dashboards, Projects, etc).
h3. Environment

Internet Explorer
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open JIRA
 # Select Favorite Filter
 # Select any of the Export features that involve downloading a file (CSV, HTML, Word)
 # Open or Save export file.
 # Click one of the drop down menu options (Dashboards, Projects, or Issues).

h3. Expected Results
Dropdown menus should appear normally

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown menus do not display correctly.
 
h3. Notes
If a dropdown menu is clicked when already in the search result screen but prior to clicking the export button it will work after exporting. Any of the dropdown menus that were not clicked won't work, though.
 
h3. Solution / Workaround

Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Using the export function in IE breaks some of the dropdown menus in the top bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the issue type scheme inside a project (*Project Settings > Issue Types > Actions > Use a different Scheme*), the message says there are *0* issues in the project, despite the number of issues that are in that project.
h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Create a few issues in this project
 # Try to change the Issue Type Scheme for this project through *Project Settings > Issue Types > Actions > Use a different Scheme*

h3. Expected Results

The next screen (Select Issue Type Scheme for project <PROJECT_NAME>) should show how many issues there are in the project.
h3. Actual Results

That screen always shows 0 issues in the project.
h3. Notes

It seems to be a visual/UI bug, since the existing issues are affected accordingly.

 

Screenshot:

!bug.png|thumbnail!
h3.
fields.summary: Changing issue type scheme displays zero issues despite the real number of issues in a project

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

[Running JIRA Data Center in AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/running-jira-data-center-in-aws-881683285.html] currently doesn't contain steps to back up and restore JIRA instances in AWS. It's not clear what need to be backed up and how to restore/migrate them in the right way, using the CloudFormation template.

Furthermore, the Upgrade method by updating the Stack doesn't seem to work as it's not possible to choose a Version as documented - refer to JRASERVER-64895.

Last, but not least, it's not clear whether the entire process is supported, and by which team (Atlassian or AWS).
h3. +Suggestion+
 # Add more details on Backup and Restore
 # Clarify the Upgrade method
 # Clearly define the Support Scope
fields.summary: Add more details to Running JIRA Data Center in AWS

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When an user mentioned another user in a comment field, the mentioned user gets the notification email. However, when that user replies on the notification, there's an inconsistent behaviour in two different JIRA versions. Can someone help to clarify which one is the expected behaviour in this case?

h3. Step to Reproduce

h4. JIRA 6.4
* User A added a comment mentioning User B.
* User B received the notification and click Reply to the notification email
* The To field specifies User A's email address

h4. JIRA 7.3.7
* User A added a comment mentioning User B.
* User B received the notification and click Reply to the notification email
* The To field specifies the mail server address
fields.summary: Inconsistent Behaviour when Replying to an Issue Mention Notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the value of an issue's workflow state does not exist in the active workflow in use no transition buttons will be present on the issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Currently we haven't determined a reliable reproduction method but we suspect the following can cause this:
 # Mis-configured CSV imports
 # Mis-configured email creation handlers
 # Workflow migrations

h3. Expected Results

Either this never occurs or JIRA is able to handle this condition gracefully such as an option to move the issue into a valid state
h3. Actual Results

Workflow transitions are missing when viewing the issue
h3. Notes

This is not a new problem and has existed in JIRA for a very long time
h3. Workaround

Fromw [Workflow transition button disappeared from the issue view page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/workflow-transition-button-disappeared-from-the-issue-view-page-800304645.html]:
{quote}Workflow inconsistency : Please move the issue to other issue type then move it back to force JIRA to trigger a workflow remap.
{quote}
fields.summary: Workflow transitions are missing from an issue view if the issue's workflow state is invalid

fields.description:
Currently, you can only use REST API to edit a draft workflow scheme as the bean doesn't implement [WorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.2.7/com/atlassian/jira/workflow/migration/WorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper.html].

It would be great to have at least the quick migration method - when it is not necessary to manually assign issues to new statuses.
fields.summary: Provide a REST API endpoint for WorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper

fields.description:
It would be great if JIRA Administrators could increase the limit of results retrieved in the Auto-complete on the Issue Navigator search.
Currently, this value is set to 15, but on a field with large sets of similar data, 15 might not be enough.
fields.summary: Allow custom values for the Auto-complete in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When adding a second comment on an issue in Visual mode, the cursor jumps and nothing is showing on the comment textbox but the characters were actually there when you switch to Text mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in IE 11 and start adding a comment
# Now, click on the comment button again
# Start typing on visual mode and you could see that the cursor jumps on the following line for each character that you type.
# Switch to Text mode and the characters that you typed were actually there but not visible in Visual mode.
# Go back to visual mode and it will show empty.

h3. Expected Behaviour
* You'd be able to type characters in Visual mode and be able to see the texts that you typed

h3. Actual Behaviour
* Not able to type texts in visual mode and not able to view the characters in visual mode.

h3. Note
Only happening in IE11 browser
fields.summary: Adding a second comment in IE 11 is broken in Visual Mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is currently not possible to link issues from a remote JIRA by using the "Linked Issues" field from an screen.
The Linked Issues field only allows us to link issues from the same JIRA server, as shown in this screenshot:
 !EditWorkflow_Screen.png|thumbnail! 

It would be nice if this field allowed us to select a Server before selecting an issue key, like it is the case with the More > Links screen, as shown in this screenshot:
 !More_Link.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important

We have some customers who defined a Workflow screen including the "Linked Issues" field, to allow their users to link issues during a transition.
Because of the limitation of the "Linked Issues" field, they can only link internal issues but instead they want to link issues from a remote JIRA server.

h3. Workaround

For now, the only workaround is to go to More > Links from the Issue View screen to link issues from a remote JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow users to link remote JIRA issues to an issue from an Edit/Creation/Workflow screen

fields.description:

Now I tried it again as I now want this behavior, but now it seems like it copies the project and I can change configurations individually.

In the support text it says it does both, but not how to do either the one or the other way around.

How does it work? Maybe you can update this link with more details:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-create-with-shared-configuration-feature]
fields.summary: Creating project with shared configuration - when is it copied and when is it shared

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Latest JIRA releases such as the 7.4.1 windows 64 bit exe installation package appear to be including the JAVA JRE 8u102 release.   This release works for JIRA, but there have been a number of Oracle patches since this was released over 1 year ago.   [Oracle JAVA 8u102 release notes - July 19th, 2016|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u102-relnotes-3021767.html].


h3. Suggested Solution
update the JAVA JRE packages to use the latest release available, currently this appears to be 8u141.


h3. Why this is important
Many JIRA installations could benefit from using this update java version both in terms of platform stability as well as bug fixes to address java bugs.

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpujan2017-2881727.html
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuapr2017-3236618.html
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpujul2017-3236622.html



h3. Workaround 
In the mean time, server customers can certainly install their own updated Oracle JAVA versions and set the JAVA_HOME parameter in order to force JIRA to use this updated JRE. Steps on how to do this are in [Installing Java - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-java-802592166.html].
fields.summary: JIRA bin/exe installers should be bundled with an updated JRE version

fields.description:
As a feature, it would be very helpful to have either notices sent to administrators regarding licensing expiration.

Recently we went over the user number in JIRA and the end users only saw it as a problem as no notices were evident unless you logged in as an administrator

Also, there is not a good method to maintain add-on expirations. A established email model and a method to export a report of all addons and expirations would be very useful in supporting both JIRA and COnfluence.

 

Thanks, Russ Robinson
fields.summary: Add on Managemennt

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently if we are running JIRA via IIS and rich text editor is enabled, when we try to edit an issue via saved filter the page will display a spinning icon indefinately.

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.3.8
* JIRA version 7.4.1
* IIS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Saved a filter 
# Go to the filter and click on any issue to open a issue in this http://jira.example.com/browse/TEST-1?filter=10000 URL format
# Click on edit button to edit the issue

h3. Expected Results
We can edit the issue as per normal behavior.

h3. Actual Results
The edit page will keep on displaying a spinning bar indefinately.
 
h3. Notes
Note that this behavior start to happen from JIRA version 7.3 and above due to the fact that starting from JIRA version 7.3 Rich Text Editor is enabled by default. The IIS configuration is configured as per our documentation at [Integrating JIRA applications with IIS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-802593039.html] or [Integrating JIRA applications with IIS using ARR|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-using-arr-313467089.html]

h3.Workaround
Disable Rich Text Editor via *JIRA Administration > system > user interface > Rich Text Editor*
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor With IIS caused Issues Cannot Be Edited Via Filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A required version picker field to the destination issue type throws an error when moving a user story with a subtask 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Version Picker field and make it required to Bug issue type
# Create an issue with Story issue type. One with subtask and another one without a subtask
# Go to the issue without a subtask and click More > Move. The issue move will go through smoothly
# Now, do the same to the issue with a Subtask
(!) Note that the Version picker field may or may not exist on the Story issue type. The bug happens as long as the Version picker field is empty on the user story issue type prior to the move. 

h3. Expected Behaviour
You should be able to move the user story with a subtask to a bug without any issue


h3. Actual Behaviour
The version picker field doesn't have a place to define the value.
[^version.png]

h3. Workaround
Define a value on the version picker field in Story issue type before moving the issue.
fields.summary: Required Version Picker field Halts the Issue Move Function when there's a Subtask

fields.description:

JIRA 6.4.x _IssueTypes_ were sorted by name while showing in UI. (They were sorted like that in cache)

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.x 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Check the order 

h3. Expected Results
IssueType is sorted by name. This is much easier to find required fields when you have a hundred of them. 

h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes
This is another example for Custom Fields:
JIRA 7.2:
!CF_issuetype_7.2.png|thumbnail! 
JIRA 6.4:
 !CF_issuetype_6.4.png|thumbnail!

Regression was introduced while refactoring {{DefaultConstantsManager.java}}

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: IssueType list is not sorted by name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when activeobjects.xml in XML backup contains unsupported data format like binary, JIRA will stop restoring XML backup and restart JIRA with data from entities.xml.


h3. Suggested Solution

When the XML restore tool find the data like binary, allow JIRA to skip those specific data and proceed to restore data from rest of activeobjects.xml *or* 

Halt the restoration process with the specific error message indicating restoration error from activeobjects.xml


h3. Workaround 

To fix this problem, user will have to remove the unsupported data type like "binary" entries and restore the edited backup. 

# Extract JIRA's backup file.
# Open the activeobjects.xml with any text editor.
# Look for the unsupported data type by searching for entries like "<binary xsi:nil="true"/>" (for binary data type) entries and remove them.
# Save the changes and compress the entities.xml & the updated activeobjects.xml to a new file.
# Restore the new backup to your new JIRA.
fields.summary: Improvement to XML restore

fields.description: As a JIRA admin, I would like the "detailed logs" of the CSV importer UI function to mention the filename of the CSV file I am importing or just finished importing, so that in the event that I have to import multiple CSV files due to filesize or execution duration limitations of the target instance, I can recall the operation that I executed several minutes ago.
fields.summary: Add .csv filename to "detailed logs"

fields.description:
h2. Problem:

When trying to copy colored formatted text from a document in Microsoft Word or Google Docs, for example, and pasting into any field (Comment or Description, for example) that is using visual JIRA Rich Text Editor plugin (bundled on JIRA or not), the colored text is not copied properly, but the bold formatted text is.
h2. Example:

Copied text from Google Docs:

!Screen Shot 2017-07-21 at 3.41.29 PM.png|width=292,height=53!

Pasted text from Google Docs to JIRA:

!Screen Shot 2017-07-21 at 3.42.00 PM.png|width=424,height=159!
h2. Cause

A Word document is not HTML or RTF. It's a proprietary, binary file format. When you copy to the clipboard the information is converted to HTML or RTF, but the result might not be what you expect. 
h2. Workaround
 # Use another document editor platform, like OpenOffice or Numbers, to paste the formatted text from Google Docs / Office
 # Copy the text from OpenOffice and paste into JIRA

h2. Suggestion

Make the JIRA Rich Text Editor plugin (WYSIWYG) copy and paste properly all the formatted content from a Microsoft Word, Pages (Mac OS) and Google Docs document, like it does with other platforms (LibreOffice and OpenOffice).

 

Tested versions: JIRA 7.1.6 with installed plugin and Wiki Text Renderer enabled and latest JIRA 7.4.1 with bundled plugin enabled and Wiki Text Renderer enabled.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG Editor flaws when trying to copy colored formatted text from Microsoft Word or Google Docs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA menus is not clickable after left for overnight without logout the account.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Remotely access JIRA server through UI and login with your OS account.
 # Login JIRA, go to dashboard page and don't logout.
 # Leave the client UI log on and don't shut it down.
 # After tomorrow, try go in the page and click the menus button. When clicking on the JIRA menus, it doesn't shows anything.

!menu-error.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Expected Results.

After click on the menu, JIRA should pop up an error or warning message said the user sessions is timeout and shows a link for user to click to refresh the page or re-login again.
h3. Actual Results.

It does nothing when clicking on the JIRA menus.
h3. Workaround

Require to refresh the page again to make it works.
fields.summary: JIRA Menus is not clickable after left for overnight

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA DC doesn't have a Lucene health-check (it was removed as part of JRASERVER-61501). As a consequence of that, JIRA Admin is missing some information : 
* if index is corrupted
* Issue last update status
* Number of issues in index 

h3. Suggested Solution
We recently introduced new REST API (see JRASERVER-65321) to expose JIRA index status. We can reuse it in Support Tools plugins for health-check.  

h3. Workaround 
Call REST API manually, see JRASERVER-65321
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want have Lucene health-check in STP

fields.description:
It is known that when there is a duplicated entity in the *JOB_ID* column in the *clustrerjob* table, there will be issues with certain JIRA operations such as a startup as mentioned in the KB: [JIRA Fails to Start due to Multiple entries with same key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-fails-to-start-due-to-multiple-entries-with-same-key-800702874.html/].

A suggestion would be to add a unique constraint to the JOB_ID column.
fields.summary: JIRA should have a unique constraint on the JOB_ID column

fields.description:
Problem Statement:

There are known cases where JIRA will encounter an issue with having multiple entries with the same key. 

This known issue has been documented in the KB: [JIRA Fails to Start due to Multiple entries with same key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-fails-to-start-due-to-multiple-entries-with-same-key-800702874.html/]. The resolution method would be to delete the problematic entry from the database directly.

Suggested approach:
JIRA should have an automation implemented to check for duplicated entries and delete them upon a startup.
fields.summary: JIRA should be able to delete duplicated entries with the same key upon startup.

fields.description:
We are looking at adopting Lithium as our Communities platform, as Atlassian has.

One feature we want, and which currently is a costly PS project through Lithium, is the ability to use a Lithium Ideas forum to receive feature requests for our various products, and automatically create an issue in JIRA (when a request gets enough votes, e.g., in Lithium).

Then, when the issue in JIRA changes status, automatically update the status in Lithium and have Lithium send out notifications to all those who voted for the request. 

Essentially, tie the two platforms together more tightly in a productized manner, rather than a fully custom PS project.
fields.summary: Create productized integration to Lithium

fields.description:
I am running a project which is integrated with Innotas and the effort logged in JIRA directly flows into. Now I need a way by which I could control the effort logging only if certain fields are populated correctly. A mix of both custom fields and OOB fields.  

It will be good if I have the ability to restrict effort logging based on values populated in certain fields.
fields.summary: Enable "Log Work" based on certain criteria
